title: Community of Practice (CoP)-Based Online Learning Program for Prospective Teachers’ Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic teaching-learning theories and elementary educational environments
context.additional_context: Emphasis on practical educational experiences based on sociocultural learning theory. Construction of collaborative learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: Enhance collaborative problem-solving competencies among pre-service teachers through community of practice activities

Learners can establish a personalized action plan (including three items such as time management and communication strategies) to enhance field adaptability through three or more one-on-one feedback sessions with a mentor teacher and achieve a score of 4 or higher out of 5 on the evaluation rubric (goal specificity, feasibility, practicality) at the course’s conclusion.

Learners can meet four or more of five rubric items per project in three project-based assessments (web development, data analysis, cloud deployment) during a six-month course and submit a final portfolio with improved practical competency evidence (code repositories, test results, user feedback).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
